This most valuable portion of Lightfoot's writings was included in the new edition of his wei-ks (13 vols„ Svo. London, 1822-5), superintended by the Rev. John Rogers Pitman‚ M. A. That edition has now become scarce and expensive3 and besides, contains much matter less interesting to modern readers. It seemed therefore desirable that the Horce Hebraicoe should be rendered accessible to theological students by being published alone.

The present edition has been printed from Mr. Pitman's; but wherever a passage seemed obscure, not only the folio edition, but the original Latin also has been consulted. Thus the text has been carefully revised throughout, and alterations made in many places. Upon the Hebrew quotations much attention has been bestowed. Very many correc- tions were required here, and though from the silni- larity of some Hebrew letters, and other causes, the Editor can hardly hope that he has overlooked no errors, yet hc can say that he has spared no pains to secure accuracy.
